name: State Road Construction Program
description:
The intent of the law is to provide payment and protection for the States roads

The law will pay for the following tasks
Tamping land (Road tool) on dirt and placing Dirt Ramps
Placing Stone Road or Stone Ramps
Placing Asphalt Roads

Write “!StateRoads” to see all payment values

Warnings:
There are not any systems that can stop citizens from tamping a dirt block, picking up the dirt block, placing the dirt block and then tamping the same block. This is a criminal offence and can be identified. Don’t do it.

Governor and LT-Governor can use the following commands
!StateRoadPriceDirtUp
!StateRoadPriceDirtDown
!StateRoadPriceStoneUp
!StateRoadPriceStoneDown
!StateRoadPriceAsphaltUp
!StateRoadPriceAsphaltDown
All commands either lower or raise the payment by 0.1
Note that all values start at 0, and must be set after law is voted in

Note when importing law:
Must have a bank account named: “# Balica Road Construction”
Must have the following titles: “Governor of Balica” and “Lieutenant Governor of Balica”
Must have district named “Balica County Roads”

Location.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="ConstructOrDeconstruct">Action Location</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="ConstructOrDeconstruct">Action Location</ecoicon>: The position where the interaction took place.

Target.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="User">Citizen</ecoicon>: The citizen who performed the interaction.

List.tooltip:
When triggered, the <ecoicon item="ConstructOrDeconstruct">Constructed</ecoicon> value of the event will be used.

<ecoicon item="ConstructOrDeconstruct">Constructed</ecoicon>: Was the block constructed or deconstructed?
